meanings.definition: To push or jab with one's elbow.
meanings.sent1: She elbowed her way through the crowd to get to the front.
meanings.sent2: He elbowed his friend playfully during the game.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel elbowed its way into the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The team elbowed their opponents out of the way to secure the win.
meanings.sent5: The determined player elbowed past the defenders to score a goal.

meanings.definition: Having elbows, especially of a certain type or number.
meanings.sent1: The robot had elbowed arms that could bend in multiple directions.
meanings.sent2: The statue had a unique design with elbowed joints.
meanings.sent3: The elbowed chair was specifically designed for comfort and support.
meanings.sent4: The elbowed branches of the tree created a cozy nook for birds to nest.
meanings.sent5: The elbowed pipe allowed for easy installation in tight spaces.

meanings.definition: Formed with an elbow or elbows.
meanings.sent1: The elbowed pipe fitting connected the two sections seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The elbowed design of the staircase added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The elbowed handle of the mug made it easier to hold.
meanings.sent4: The elbowed path led us through the scenic garden.
meanings.sent5: The elbowed connector allowed for flexibility in the plumbing system.
